Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin obligāre.

Verb

[edit]

obligar

  1. to oblige; to force

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of obligar
infinitive obligar
gerund obligando
past participle m obligáu, f obligada, n obligao, m pl obligaos, f pl obligaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present obligo obligues obliga obligamos obligáis obliguen
imperfect obligaba obligabes obligaba obligábemos, obligábamos obligabeis, obligabais obligaben
preterite obligué obligasti, obliguesti obligó obliguemos obligastis, obliguestis obligaron
pluperfect obligare, obligara obligares, obligaras obligare, obligara obligáremos, obligáramos obligareis, obligarais obligaren, obligaran
future obligaré obligarás obligará obligaremos obligaréis obligarán
conditional obligaría obligaríes obligaría obligaríemos, obligaríamos obligaríeis, obligaríais obligaríen
subjunctive present obligue obligues, obligas obligue obliguemos obliguéis obliguen, obligan
imperfect obligare, obligara obligares, obligaras obligare, obligara obligáremos, obligáramos obligareis, obligarais obligaren, obligaran
imperative — obliga — — obligái —

Related terms

[edit]
  • obligación

Further reading

[edit]
  • “obligar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “obligar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin obligāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [u.βliˈɣa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [o.bliˈɣa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [o.bliˈɣaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

obligar (first-person singular present obligo, first-person singular preterite obliguí, past participle obligat)

  1. to oblige, force, obligate

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • lligar
  • obligació

Further reading

[edit]
  • “obligar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “obligar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “obligar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “obligar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin obligāre. Cognate with English oblige and obligate.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /obliˈɡaɾ/ [o.β̞liˈɣ̞aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: o‧bli‧gar

Verb

[edit]

obligar (first-person singular present obligo, first-person singular preterite obligué, past participle obligado)

  1. to force, to compel, to make (someone do something)
    Por favor no me obligues a hacer esto.
    Please don't make me do this.
  2. to oblige, to obligate, to bind
    La Carta de las Naciones Unidas obliga a todos los miembros de la organización a respetar el principio de la no discriminación.
    The Charter of the United Nations binds all the members of the organization to respect the principle of non-discrimination.
  3. (reflexive, law) to be bound, to be obliged, to be obligated
  4. (reflexive) to force oneself or make oneself (do something)
  5. (reflexive) to commit oneself

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

Venetan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin obligāre. Compare Italian obbligare.

Verb

[edit]

obligar

  1. (transitive) to oblige, compel

Conjugation

[edit]

* Venetan conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.

Conjugation of obligar (first conjugation)
infinitive obligar
auxiliary verb aver gerund obligando
past participle obligà
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative mi ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
present obligo (te) oblighi (el/ła) obliga oblighémo, obligòn oblighé (i/łe) obliga
imperfect obligava (te) obligavi (el/ła) obligava obligàvimo obligavi (i/łe) obligava
future obligarò (te) obligarè (el/ła) obligarà obligarémo obligarè (i/łe) obligarà
conditional obligarìa (te) obligarisi (el/ła) obligarìa obligarìsimo obligarisi (i/łe) obligarìa
subjunctive che mi che ti che eło / eła che noialtri / noialtre che voialtri / voialtre che łuri / łore
present oblighe, obliga (te) oblighi (el/ła) oblighe, (el/ła) obliga oblighémo, obligone oblighé (i/łe) oblighe, (i/łe) obliga
imperfect obligase (te) obligasi (el/ła) obligase obligàsimo obligasi (i/łe) obligase
imperative — ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
— (te) obliga (el/ła) obliga, (el/ła) oblighe oblighémo oblighé (i/łe) obliga, (i/łe) oblighe

Related terms

[edit]
  • obligà
  • łigar
